intro: Rubus largificus, commonly known as the large-fruited blackberry, is a species of brambles native to North America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color when mature. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils.
